intro: Scaphochlamys johorensis, commonly known as the Johore scaphochlamys, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Singapore. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in humid, shaded environments. The fruit is a capsule that disperses its seeds through wind or animals, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
